verses.verse: Knowest <S%H3045><s%> thou the time <S%H6256><s%> when the wild goats <S%H3277><s%> of the rock <S%H5553><s%> bring forth <S%H3205><s%>? or canst thou mark <S%H8104><s%> when the hinds <S%H355><s%> do calve <S%H2342><s%>?
Canst thou number <S%H5608><s%> the months <S%H3391><s%> that they fulfil <S%H4390><s%>? or knowest <S%H3045><s%> thou the time <S%H6256><s%> when they bring forth <S%H3205><s%>?
They bow <S%H3766><s%> themselves, they bring forth <S%H6398><s%> their young ones <S%H3206><s%>, they cast out <S%H7971><s%> their sorrows <S%H2256><s%>.
Their young ones <S%H1121><s%> are in good liking <S%H2492><s%>, they grow up <S%H7235><s%> with corn <S%H1250><s%>; they go forth <S%H3318><s%>, and return <S%H7725><s%> not unto them.
Who hath sent out <S%H7971><s%> the wild ass <S%H6501><s%> free <S%H2670><s%>? or who hath loosed <S%H6605><s%> the bands <S%H4147><s%> of the wild ass <S%H6171><s%>?
Whose house <S%H1004><s%> I have made <S%H7760><s%> the wilderness <S%H6160><s%>, and the barren <S%H4420><s%> land his dwellings <S%H4908><s%>.
He scorneth <S%H7832><s%> the multitude <S%H1995><s%> of the city <S%H7151><s%>, neither regardeth <S%H8085><s%> he the crying <S%H8663><s%> of the driver <S%H5065><s%>.
The range <S%H3491><s%> of the mountains <S%H2022><s%> is his pasture <S%H4829><s%>, and he searcheth <S%H1875><s%> after <S%H310><s%> every green thing <S%H3387><s%>.
Will the unicorn <S%H7214><s%> be willing <S%H14><s%> to serve <S%H5647><s%> thee, or abide <S%H3885><s%> by thy crib <S%H18><s%>?
Canst thou bind <S%H7194><s%> the unicorn <S%H7214><s%> with his band <S%H5688><s%> in the furrow <S%H8525><s%>? or will he harrow <S%H7702><s%> the valleys <S%H6010><s%> after <S%H310><s%> thee?
Wilt thou trust <S%H982><s%> him, because his strength <S%H3581><s%> is great <S%H7227><s%>? or wilt thou leave <S%H5800><s%> thy labour <S%H3018><s%> to him?
Wilt thou believe <S%H539><s%> him, that he will bring home <S%H7725><s%> <S%H7725><s%> thy seed <S%H2233><s%>, and gather <S%H622><s%> it into thy barn <S%H1637><s%>?
Gavest thou the goodly <S%H7443><s%> wings <S%H3671><s%> unto the peacocks <S%H5965><s%>? or wings <S%H84><s%> and feathers <S%H2624><s%> unto the ostrich <S%H5133><s%>?
Which leaveth <S%H5800><s%> her eggs <S%H1000><s%> in the earth <S%H776><s%>, and warmeth <S%H2552><s%> them in dust <S%H6083><s%>,
And forgetteth <S%H7911><s%> that the foot <S%H7272><s%> may crush <S%H2115><s%> them, or that the wild <S%H7704><s%> beast <S%H2416><s%> may break <S%H1758><s%> them.
She is hardened <S%H7188><s%> against her young ones <S%H1121><s%>, as though they were not <S%H3808><s%> hers: her labour <S%H3018><s%> is in vain <S%H7385><s%> without fear <S%H6343><s%>;
Because God <S%H433><s%> hath deprived <S%H5382><s%> her of wisdom <S%H2451><s%>, neither hath he imparted <S%H2505><s%> to her understanding <S%H998><s%>.
What time <S%H6256><s%> she lifteth up <S%H4754><s%> herself on high <S%H4791><s%>, she scorneth <S%H7832><s%> the horse <S%H5483><s%> and his rider <S%H7392><s%>.
Hast thou given <S%H5414><s%> the horse <S%H5483><s%> strength <S%H1369><s%>? hast thou clothed <S%H3847><s%> his neck <S%H6677><s%> with thunder <S%H7483><s%>?
Canst thou make him afraid <S%H7493><s%> as a grasshopper <S%H697><s%>? the glory <S%H1935><s%> of his nostrils <S%H5170><s%> is terrible <S%H367><s%>.
He paweth <S%H2658><s%> in the valley <S%H6010><s%>, and rejoiceth <S%H7797><s%> in his strength <S%H3581><s%>: he goeth on <S%H3318><s%> to meet <S%H7125><s%> the armed men <S%H5402><s%>.
He mocketh <S%H7832><s%> at fear <S%H6343><s%>, and is not affrighted <S%H2865><s%>; neither turneth he back <S%H7725><s%> from <S%H6440><s%> the sword <S%H2719><s%>.
The quiver <S%H827><s%> rattleth <S%H7439><s%> against him, the glittering <S%H3851><s%> spear <S%H2595><s%> and the shield <S%H3591><s%>.

He swalloweth <S%H1572><s%> the ground <S%H776><s%> with fierceness <S%H7494><s%> and rage <S%H7267><s%>: neither believeth <S%H539><s%> he that it is the sound <S%H6963><s%> of the trumpet <S%H7782><s%>.

He saith <S%H559><s%> among <S%H1767><s%> the trumpets <S%H7782><s%>, Ha <S%H1889><s%>, ha <S%H1889><s%>; and he smelleth <S%H7306><s%> the battle <S%H4421><s%> afar off <S%H7350><s%>, the thunder <S%H7482><s%> of the captains <S%H8269><s%>, and the shouting <S%H8643><s%>.
Doth the hawk <S%H5322><s%> fly <S%H82><s%> by thy wisdom <S%H998><s%>, and stretch <S%H6566><s%> her wings <S%H3671><s%> toward the south <S%H8486><s%>?
Doth the eagle <S%H5404><s%> mount up <S%H1361><s%> at thy command <S%H6310><s%>, and make <S%H7311><s%> her nest <S%H7064><s%> on high <S%H7311><s%>?
She dwelleth <S%H7931><s%> and abideth <S%H3885><s%> on the rock <S%H5553><s%>, upon the crag <S%H8127><s%> of the rock <S%H5553><s%>, and the strong place <S%H4686><s%>.
From thence she seeketh <S%H2658><s%> the prey <S%H400><s%>, and her eyes <S%H5869><s%> behold <S%H5027><s%> afar off <S%H7350><s%>.
Her young ones <S%H667><s%> also suck up <S%H5966><s%> blood <S%H1818><s%>: and where the slain <S%H2491><s%> are, there is she <S%H1931><s%>.
